publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-768# Robin Harper: Farmed Salmon and Human Health-That the Parliament notes the publication in the journal Science of an article exposing high levels of organic contaminants in Scottish farmed salmon; recognises that Scotland's reputation as a producer of high quality food is compromised by such contamination, and believes that the Scottish Executive must act without delay to investigate the source of toxic contaminants in feed and elsewhere in order to protect public health and in the interests of securing a sustainable future for the Scottish aquaculture industry.

S2M-768# Robin Harper: Farmed Salmon and Human Health-That the Parliament notes the publication in the journal Science of an article exposing high levels of organic contaminants in Scottish farmed salmon; recognises that Scotland's reputation as a producer of high quality food is compromised by such contamination, and believes that the Scottish Executive must act without delay to investigate the source of toxic contaminants in feed and elsewhere in order to protect public health and in the interests of securing a sustainable future for the Scottish aquaculture industry. Supported by: Patrick Harvie*, Mr Mark Ruskell*, Eleanor Scott*, Mark Ballard*, Shiona Baird*, Chris Ballance*
S2M-768# Farmed Salmon and Human Health (lodged on 8 January 2004) Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-768# Farmed Salmon and Human Health (lodged on 8 January 2004) Carolyn Leckie*
S2M-768# Farmed Salmon and Human Health (lodged on 8 January 2004) Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Dr Jean Turner*, Frances Curran*, Rosie Kane*
S2M-768# Farmed Salmon and Human Health (lodged on 8 January 2004) Rob Gibson*
S2M-768# Farmed Salmon and Human Health (lodged on 8 January 2004) John Swinburne*
